meta.title: In Denmark
meta.source: John M. Lilley Library, Penn State Behrend Archives
meta.summary: This letter begins with a handwritten portion that was illegible to us, but we hope to work on transcribing it in the future. "Denmark" is legibly written in the margin. The rest of the letter describes a lively day of entertainment, shopping for unique crafts, and enjoying a fine dinner, capped off with a circus show featuring elephants and acrobats.

page.p: Very gay place. Music and all sorts of PLACES to spend cash for fun. Gail shot bears abd bul eyes and smashed up plates. It iis truly a nice place. Everyone very orderly and enjoying i t.

July 27th. Went to the TRAvel Agency. Went over to the D8angleterre (No Rooms) Hotel, and to an art craft place next to it where I got some wonderful things! Lions made of rope, lunch doilies with designs of all nations. Things for Kissie, a beaded bracelet,Gloves, etc.Had lunch the D'andDleT terre.Couldn't get rooms there- all full.Went to the Permente- a place thet shows all sorts of things to buy Got a skirt, linen table cloth, scarves,fish doilies, At 4.30 we went on the city tour In a bus. all around. Back to hotel- flowers from Mr and mrs Dessau. They had called. Went to the Coc D'or and had a very fine dinner. ON way back to hotel passed the Circus Schuman WE couldn't get in- laws that prevent when it is full up- but a very nice attentant let us stand upstairs behinf the rows of people. So we saw a lot of itnand it wwas a grand show. Elephants, acrobats and all sorts of acts. W
